title: Case-Based Learning Process for Developing Clinical Reasoning Skills in Elementary Mathematics

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics curriculum content (operations, problem-solving) and basic educational practice experience
context.additional_context: A process for in-service elementary teachers to develop clinical reasoning skills based on real classroom cases, conducted primarily via smartphones in PC-unavailable settings, structured around asynchronous learning activities via LMS.

learning_goals: Learners can extract key problem-solving elements from actual elementary math class cases with 80% accuracy
Learners can propose three or more math error diagnosis and correction strategies through case-based learning (CBL)
Learners can improve their reasoning processes two or more times by reflecting on peer evaluations and feedback

resources: Case Database (20 Elementary Mathematics Error Cases)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
